text: Survivors of genocide illuminate darkest moments of history through @USCShoahFdn's Visual History Archive, recently acquired by Cornell University Library. Visit our LibGuide (created by Rob Kotaska and Patrick J. Stevens): https://t.co/hNQ7kK5j8W   #NeverAgain https://t.co/vgKOumAPyW
RT @WorkingatDuke: Late lawyer Raphael Lemkin coined the term "genocide" when crafting a legal framework for the aftermath of WWII. Lemkin…

Next Wed., Jan. 16, UCLA historian Benjamin Madley will discuss the near-annihilation and survival of California's indigenous population, documented in his book 'American Genocide.' The talk will be followed by a book signing. Free; Rothenberg Hall. https://t.co/qjhjXucaI6 https://t.co/YyTTqWF6pV

Please join us Thursday, Nov. 29, at #SterlingMemorialLibrary for a symposium in memory and honor of Dr. Dori Laub, co-founder of @Yale's Fortunoff Video Archive for #Holocaust Testimony and @YaleMacMillan Genocide Studies program. https://t.co/AfKzVsiF8y

A symposium at Sterling Memorial Library on Thursday, Nov.  29, will honor the life and legacy of Dr. Dori Laub, co-founder of the Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies and Yale’s Genocide Studies Program. https://t.co/B7PM2CkOIW
RT @Yale: Nov 29 1-5pm: Symposium in honor of Dori Laub, co-founder of Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies & Yale Genocide St…

Please join us for a presentation by Prof. Omer Bartov, who will present his latest work Anatomy of a Genocide: The Life and Death of a Town Named Buczacz. He explains  ethnic cleansing doesn’t occur as portrayed in popular history. Mon., 10/ 8, 5 - 7pm, Sterling Memorial Library https://t.co/rvsC1UpP4u

Tomorrow, at @HoughtonLib, Dr. Sylvie Merian will use 2 of the library's manuscripts to examine the history of cultural genocide within the Armenian context + highlight the importance of artifacts as key to the survival of the Armenian people.

RSVP: https://t.co/5jCO0M2cxV https://t.co/BNxa0FpGev
In memoriam: Dr. Dori Laub, co-founder of the Fortunoff Video Archive @YaleLibrary and @Yale’s genocide studies program https://t.co/rNHr5dxnBM
